agency_desc: Provides electric service for customers within service area.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in portions of Benton, Carroll, Cass, Clinton, Howard, Jasper, Pulaski, Tippecanoe and White counties.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a 24-hour payment kiosk is available at this location.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4:30pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing a variety of mental health services, including a crisis line, inpatient and outpatient services, and substance abuse services.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance abuse issues. Intensive outpatient services are available for adults.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: * Call the office for information or to schedule an appointment* Walk in for emergency assessment or crisis intervention.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency providing a variety of mental health services, including a crisis line, inpatient and outpatient services, and substance abuse services.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, couples, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, and home- and community-based services are available to eligible clients receiving treatment at this center.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information or to a schedule an appointment -- Walk in for emergency assessment or crisis intervention.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment)

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves White County

service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
site_details: Call for information -- Walk in or visit website to register
site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides services for seniors including social activities and public transit-transportation for all ages.
service_description: Provides public transportation services to persons living in White County and set areas of Carroll County. Transportation is also available for destinations in Tippecanoe County of Lafayette, Indiana. Wheelchair accessible vehicle is available upon request.
site_details: Call to schedule a ride; at least 24 hours notice for in-county transportation; one week notice for trips to Lafayette.
site_eligibility: Living in White County or in Adams or Jefferson township of Carroll County

service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food, toiletries, and women's hygiene supplies to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for details.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides prescription expense assistance for White County persons in need. Assistance is limited to insulin or prescribed medication for blood pressure, kidney conditions or ADHD. Assistance is provided on a case-by-case basis; limited to one prescription, one time only. No narcotics will be approved for this service.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment; clients will need to complete an application.
site_eligibility: Living in White County -- With a current prescription (non-narcotic) -- Not already received prescription assistance from this agency

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of White County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, and air or water pollution.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service -- serves White County

service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.

site_eligibility: Living within the county

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in White County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for White County.
service_description: Maintains the White County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.

site_schedule: Jail Phone: Daily 24 hours -- Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: To visit (online): Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for White County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in White County. agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Solicits individual and corporate donations to fund and support partner agencies and programs that address human service needs in White County. All assistance is provided through partnering agencies; no direct services are provided through this agency.

site_eligibility: Human services agencies in White County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Offers age-appropriate reading books for children, up to age 5. Children may receive materials on a monthly basis. Registration is required for participation. Limited service area.
site_details: Register online. -- The form may also be printed from the website and returned in person or by mail.
site_eligibility: Children 0-5 years old

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Offers a school readiness program each summer for incoming White County kindergarten students. Services are provided to prepare children with little or no preschool experience for entering Kindergarten the following fall. Camp takes place at Frontier Elementary School, Meadowlawn Elementary School, North White Elementary School, and Tri-County Primary School.
site_details: Visit the website, call, or contact school of registration for more information.
site_eligibility: Incoming kindergarteners who plan to attend White County school -- Child must be age 5 on or before Aug 1

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides transportation to medical appointments for area veterans to the veterans' hospital or clinic in Indianapolis, Chicago, Danville, and Monticello, Indiana.
site_details: Call at least 7 days in advance.
site_eligibility: Veterans living in White County -- With an appointment at the veterans' hospital or clinic in Indianapolis, Chicago, Danville, and Monticello, Indiana

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering a food pantry to those in need.

site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services.

agency_name: BIG CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - WHITE COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: BIG CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - WHITE COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call or send an email to request an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A division of Purdue University offering nurse-managed community clinics.
service_description: Provides health education and primary care services to patients of all ages. Available services include routine exams, health screenings, diagnosis and treatment of minor and chronic health conditions, treatment of minor injuries and illnesses, flu vaccinations, immunizations, gynecological care, limited prenatal care, CDL/DOT physicals and physicals for school, sports, or work. Care is provided by Advance Practice Nurses in collaboration with area physicians or specialists
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or to apply for financial assistance.
site_eligibility: For Clinic: Open -- For Sliding-scale Fees: Uninsured -- Household income at or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A division of Purdue University offering nurse-managed community clinics.
service_description: Provides telephone and in-person information and enrollment assistance for plans in the Health Insurance Marketplace established by the Affordable Care Act. The Open Enrollment period for the Health Insurance Marketplace is November 1 to December 15. Enrollment assistance for Medicaid including Healthy Indiana Plan. SHIP Medicare counseling for Medicare recipients. All Navigator services are free of charge.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or to obtain information about the Health Insurance Marketplace.
site_eligibility: For Information and Assistance: Open -- For Marketplace Enrollment: Household income at least 100% Federal Poverty Level (for subsidy, household income must be between 100%-400% FPL) -- US citizen or legal resident -- Not currently incarcerated

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in White County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in White County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in White County

agency_desc: Serves as the Executive and administrative authority for White County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for White County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8:15am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in the town of Brookston or Prairie Township

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $8,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In White County, the Superior Court handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $8,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in White County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in White County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in White County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the White County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the White County Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in White County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys, or individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the Circuit Court.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees court cases involving White County minors, including petitions for emancipation, children in need of services (CHINS), and minors accused of delinquency or status offenses.
site_details: By court order; parents cannot self-refer children to juvenile court
site_eligibility: White County juveniles age 17 and under
